Pre-Game Insights: The Detroit Tigers are riding a five-game winning streak and are the hottest team in baseball.
Brant Hurter fired five strong innings, surrendering only two runs in the previous game.
The Tigers' lineup has been contributing significantly, with Jake Rogers, Riley Greene, and Kerry Carpenter all hitting home runs.
Matt Vierling provided support with an RBI double, and Kerry Carpenter with a single.
Detroit is receiving contributions from several arms on the pitching staff beyond Cy Young Award favorite Tarik Skubal.
Mason Englert will make his first start of the season, while Kenta Maeda could be in line to pitch behind him.
Griffin Canning will take the mound for the Angels, with a 4-11 record and a 5.18 ERA.
The Tigers are a sizable favorite tonight, listed at -165, with an implied probability of 62.1% chance to win.
The over/under for runs scored is set at nine.
